Celtic host their rivals on December 30 and the gap at the top of the Scottish Premiership could be closing in on their rivals if they defeat St Johnstone in one of their games in hand. It will be the Belgian's first taste of the red hot Old Firm fixture and it could be a pivotal one if the Light Blues can leapfrog their rivals to go top. However, Lambert reckons the knowhow this Celtic squad and Brendan Rodgers have for just the type of occasion gives them the edge and that victory would put them out in front when it comes to motoring on and claiming the Premiership crown. We saw the same thing happen at Ibrox back in May - and I think that was terrible, too. ‚ÄúClement is walking into a game where his international experience means nothing. However, I still think Celtic are favourites as they're at home.‚Äù Celtic claimed a first home win in the Champions League for a decade in midweek. Gustaf Lagerbielke scores to make it 2-1 ‚ÄúWe couldn't seem to get a point away from home. When I won the Champions League with Dortmund, we finished second in our group and we had 13 points, which was incredible! ‚ÄúCeltic are a different animal at home. The atmosphere at Celtic Park is unmatched and they'll be a match for most teams there. They need to make sure they win their home games and see what happens on their travels. ‚ÄúThey should have beaten Lazio at Celtic Park and they have to win against Feyenoord just to end the campaign on a high. The 2-2 game against Atletico was incredible and most teams would have taken that result. ‚ÄúI was at the Lazio game, and that could have gone either way in Rome. They shouldn't have lost the home leg, and perhaps they wouldn't have if they had better game management and experience. ‚ÄúCeltic are doing their best with the finances they have. newsArray.content: Tottenham‚Äôs Molly Bartrip believes there are plenty of similarities between Ange Postecoglou and Robert Vilahamn, as the north London side eye a Champions League finish this season. Vilahamn was appointed as Tottenham Women‚Äôs new head coach shortly after Postecoglou‚Äôs arrival in and the Swede told talkSPORT in the summer about how he was trying to replicate the Australian‚Äôs style of play in his new role. It has certainly had the desired effect as Spurs have been one of the stories of the Women‚Äôs Super League (WSL) season, winning plaudits for their attractive brand of football. Despite recent heavy defeats to Manchester City and Manchester United, there is still plenty to be excited about for Spurs ‚Äì who sit in sixth place in the table - and Bartrip says Vilahamn has given belief to the squad after an underwhelming season last year. Speaking exclusively to talkSPORT, Bartrip said: ‚ÄúThere are similarities [between Vilahamn and Postecoglou]. I think you can see very clearly that there are. They want to play a way and they‚Äôre going to play a way where it doesn‚Äôt matter who the opposition is. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre going to play the Tottenham way and in the next few years, you‚Äôre going to see it be successful because that‚Äôs what the club wants. ‚ÄúSo, in that way, it‚Äôs actually a really refreshing thing to be a part of [because] you know that this is the way we want to play and you just have to adapt to it. I‚Äôm lucky that I think this style suits me a lot, but at the same time, I think it‚Äôs really important that as footballers, you have to be adaptable. ‚ÄúThe biggest thing Robert‚Äôs brought to us is just to be brave and I think that comes on the pitch [and] off the pitch [and] it puts people out of their comfort zone and I don‚Äôt think a lot of people are used to it. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs given me a lot of confidence. I am a confidence player ‚Äì I‚Äôm not going to shy away from that ‚Äì and he‚Äôs believed in all of us I think and it‚Äôs not easy to be a manager of 26 players. ‚ÄúHe is definitely a manager you want to play for. He‚Äôs actually a really funny guy, too, and I think it helps when sometimes, you feel like they‚Äôre a real human and you can talk to them about other things that doesn‚Äôt even involve football. To be able to connect in that way is so important.‚Äù Bartrip has excelled this season for Spurs and worn the captain‚Äôs armband in Bethany England‚Äôs absence, with the Lionesses forward missing most of the season through injury. The centre-back‚Äôs performances have impressed her manager, with Vilahamn touting Bartrip for a future England call-up, and representing her country would be a dream come true for the 27-year-old. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd be lying to say that wasn‚Äôt a dream of mine.
